result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

2:10 PM (64-06) Defendant David A Conrad appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jacob Hilton in court for David A Conrad.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Flitcroft in court for other cases.
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Attorney Hilton will accept that the Information will mirror the Complaint. Enters not guilty plea to all charges on behalf of his client.

2:02 PM (64-06) Defendant David A Conrad appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jason Mitchel Daane in court for David A Conrad.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin.
Court was in session for a Preliminary Hearing.

Respondent does not object to setting Preliminary Hearing to next Friday.
Court finds good cause to toll time limits.

Defendant David A Conrad in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Jason Mitchel Daane in court for David A Conrad.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Rights given and preliminary hearing requested. Within time period. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Signature bond returned. Defendant refused to sign.
Original Warrant filed with the court.

BOND TO COVER ALL CASES 22GF937, 22CF442, 21CF506, & 20CM734

DEFENDANT MUST POST $5000 CASH

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH A.J.N. dob 9-22-1928, S.A.R. dob 5-14-1982. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 
22-4189 thru 22-4191
